div.p: To GROW so as to BECOME STRONG AND ABUNDANT.
1. The current general word for flourishing or thriving of any kind, abstract or concrete is shèng 盛 (ant. shuāi 衰 "decline").
2. Chāng 昌 and xīng 興 (all ant. wáng 亡 "be ruined"), and lóng 隆 (ant. tì 替 "decline") refer primarily to the flourishing of political institutions and the like.
3. Xí 息, zhí 殖, and fān 蕃 refer specifically to the flourishing of flora and fauna.
4. The literal word for luxuriant growth of plants is mào 茂 (ant. diāo 凋 "dried up").
5. Róng 榮 (ant. kū 枯 "dried up") refers especially to splendid luxuriance of growth as an admirable sight.
6. Fēng 豐 (ant.* wěi 萎 "dried up and thin on the ground") refers to rich thick growth, often as an asset.
7. Fān 蕃 and yù 鬱 (mostly reduplicated yù yù 鬱鬱 ) refer to ample thick growth.
8. Fú shū 扶疏 is a poetic word referring to luxurious growth of plants.
NB: There is a remarkable abundance of terminology in this semantic field, and in many cases the distinctions are less than clear.
rough draft to BEGIN TO identify synonym group members for analysis, based on CL etc. 18.11.2003. CH ／

sense.def: be very dense; be all luxuriant

entry.def: Xí 息, zhí 殖, and fān 蕃 refer specifically to the flourishing of flora and fauna.
Chāng 昌 and xīng 興 (all ant. wáng 亡 "be ruined"), and lóng 隆 (ant. tì 替 "decline") refer primarily to the flourishing of political institutions and the like.
Róng 榮 (ant. kū 枯 "dried up") refers especially to splendid luxuriance of growth as an admirable sight.

sense.def: be abundant; be in strong shape

entry.def: The current general word for flourishing or thriving of any kind, abstract or concrete is shèng 盛 (ant. shuāi 衰 "decline").

sense.def: be in a flourishing state, be in full vigour
grow strong; thrive, be currently flourishing and strong, flourish, thrive; flourishing; (of poisons etc.) become virulent
start to flourish; begin to dominate
come to develop strongly (again); get to flourish (again); rise to power
feel stimulated, come to flourish psychologically
flourish in; come to develop strongly in; develop positively in
cause to develop postitively, promote; cause to flourish; bring to fruition
come to impose itself/oneself in all one's splendour

entry.def: The literal word for luxuriant growth of plants is mào 茂 (ant. diāo 凋 "dried up").
Fān 蕃 and yù 鬱 (mostly reduplicated yù yù 鬱鬱) refer to ample thick growth.

sense.def: cause to flourish; allow to flourish

entry.def: Fēng 豐 (ant.* wěi 萎 "dried up and thin on the ground") refers to rich thick growth, often as an asset.

sense.def: be of rich vegetation or in commerce (see ABUNDANT)
become distinguished and flourish; make a name for oneself

entry.def: Fān 蕃 and yù 鬱 (mostly reduplicated yù yù 鬱鬱) refer to ample thick growth.

sense.def: in abundant number, in a thick crowd
flourish so as to become dominant

entry.def: Fú shū 扶疏 is a poetic word referring to luxurious growth of plants.

sense.def: flourish and be popular, enjoy popularity
start to flourish, rise to full flower or power
be flourishing; be in strong shape
(= bórán 勃然) in a way evoking great flourishing
(= bórán 勃然) in a way evoking great flourishing
